title: (x) Looking for full character set samples of Coffee Shop and Stiletto by Font Diner {Mike Y}
content: hi. i'm trying to find character samples of these two fonts. any ideas? thanks.
author: lellis

comments.content:
[http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_brown.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130224091334/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_brown.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_brown.html")  
 [http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_dinner.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130224091334/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_dinner.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_dinner.html")

or did you mean full character sets?

I have the collection of Font Diner fonts that were sent to me very generously by Stuart Sandler, so that I could make samples for the Script Font ID Guide. I still have to make samples of these two, but I will try to do them in a few minutes and point you to them.

- Mike Yanega

Here are the images I made for these two fonts.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130224091334im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CoffeeShop_3823.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130224091334im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Stiletto_5545.gif)
Thanks, Mike. I had a feeling it might be you that would save the day! I take it Stiletto has no u/c? Libby

That's right. My sample template uses initial caps for each word, with the rest lower case, so this font has two sets of lower case characters.

- Mike Yanega
